greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Heinz number of the origin-to-boundary partition of the Young diagram of the integer partition with Heinz number n.
comment: The k-th part of the origin-to-boundary partition of a Young diagram is the number of squares graph-distance k from the lower-right boundary.
The Heinz number of an integer partition (y_1,...,y_k) is prime(y_1)*...*prime(y_k).
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Graph Distance.
example: The partition with Heinz number 7865 is (6,5,5,3), with diagram
o o o o o o
giving the origin-to-boundary partition (7,5,4,3) with Heinz number 6545, so a(7865) = 6545.
xref: The only terms appearing only once are the primorials A002110.
The union consists of all squarefree numbers A005117.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Apr 08 2019
